gov.usgs.anss.edgemom

Class DataLinkSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
        • gov.usgs.anss.edgemom.DataLinkSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class DataLinkSocket
extends EdgeThread
    This class receives data from a socket. It is normally created by the DataLinkServer as each connection comes in. It inherits its arguments from the DataLinkServer configuration (no hydra, no udp chan, etc.). As it reads the MiniSeed, its buffer size can be adapted if B1000 indicates blocks of bigger sizes. It also breaks 4k packets into 512 sizes unless configured otherwise.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataLinkSocket

        public DataLinkSocket(java.net.Socket s,
                      DataLinkServer par,
                      java.lang.String tg,
                      ChannelSender c,
                      boolean hydraFlag,
                      boolean allow4096,
                      int wait,
                      boolean q330,
                      boolean scnmode,
                      boolean rawSend,
                      double maxRawRate)
        Create a new instance of DataLinkSocket (usually for DataLinkServer).
        Parameters:
        s - The socket to read the data from.
        par - The parent object. Used for logging to the same file.
        tg - The EdgeThread tag to use.
        c - The channel sender to use (null if sending is disabled).
        hydraFlag - If True, send all data to hydra on receipt.
        allow4096 - If true, 4k packets to go database rather than the default of being split up into 512 packets.
        wait - Wait time in milliseconds between each block received.
        q330 - If true, do Q330 checking.
        scnmode - If true, strip off locations.
        rawSend - if true send raw receive packets with rates less than maxRawRate to OutputInfrastructure
        maxRawRate - Max rate to include in raw send, rates above this will only be sent as MiniSEED
